title: NBA trade buzz: Live updates and intel during deadline week
content: Kristaps Porzingis is headed to the Warriors, and Giannis is not. Catch up on what we're hearing from insiders.

title: Sources: Dubs deal Kuminga, Hield for Porzingis
content: The Warriors are trading Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield to the Hawks for Kristaps Porzingis, sources told ESPN, unofficially putting an end to Golden State's pursuit of Giannis Antetokounmpo.

title: Sources: Tigers land Valdez for 3 years, $115M
content: Framber Valdez and the Tigers are in agreement on a three-year, $115 million contract, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan, the highest average annual value ever for a left-handed pitcher.

title: NCAA denies appeal for Ole Miss QB Chambliss
content: The NCAA has denied Ole Miss' appeal for Trinidad Chambliss' sixth-year eligibility waiver, which will direct his fight to play college football in 2026 to state court.

title: Sources: Mavs overhaul again, trade AD to Wiz
content: The Mavericks are trading 10-time All-Star Anthony Davis to the Wizards as part of an eight-player trade, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Sources: Lonzo to become free agent after trade
content: The Jazz have acquired Lonzo Ball in a three-team trade with the Cavaliers and Hawks but are expected to waive the veteran guard and allow him to become a free agent, sources told ESPN.

title: Portland, led by injured coach, stuns No. 6 Zags
content: Portland pulled off one of the biggest upsets in school history Wednesday night, an 87-80 stunner over No. 6 Gonzaga that came just days after coach Shantay Legans tore his Achilles in practice.

title: Sources: Paul lands with Raptors in 3-team trade
content: Chris Paul, a 12-time NBA All-Star, has landed with the Raptors amid a three-team trade involving the Clippers and the Nets, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Izzo threatens to bench Fears after critical tech
content: Michigan State head coach Tom Izzo called out star guard Jeremy Fears after he was accused of employ dirty tactics for the second straight game, this time earning a critical technical foul in a 76-73 loss to Minnesota.

title: Grading every NBA trade: Which teams have fared best?
content: The Cavaliers, Celtics, Hawks, Mavericks and Warriors are among the teams that have made trades. We're grading every deal.

title: Who you calling old? At the 2026 Olympics, age is just a number
content: Lindsey Vonn, Nick Goepper, Gus Kenworthy and Maddy Schaffrick are in their golden years at the 2026 Olympics. Just don't call them old.

title: How Laila Edwards carved her own path as USA Hockey's first Black player
content: Laila Edwards, a standout at Wisconsin, is ready for her Olympic debut as USA Hockey's first Black player.

title: Power Rankings: Can Texas exact revenge and snap LSU's win streak?
content: The Tigers seek to sweep a key series in the SEC, but the Longhorns look to avenge their loss in Baton Rouge from last month.

title: Ranking the top 12 men's Coach of the Year contenders at midseason
content: From Fred Hoiberg and the turnaround he's authored at Nebraska to usual suspects, see who made the short list.

title: Bracketology: The good, and the less good, about Illinois' recent success
content: The Fighting Illini are the top 2-seed -- with plenty of time this season to move further up the board.

title: High school stories of 11 Super Bowl stars -- and two coaches
content: Find out what Sam Darnold, Drake Maye, Cooper Kupp, TreVeyon Henderson and others were like before the NFL.

title: Christian Gonzalez vs. JSN? Will Campbell vs. DeMarcus Lawrence? Sorting five key Super Bowl matchups
content: Can Christian Gonzalez contain Jaxon Smith-Njigba? Will DeMarcus Lawrence get the best of Will Campbell? Here are five matchups that will matter Sunday.

title: Our full list of Super Bowl LX picks: 58 experts predict the final score of Seahawks-Patriots
content: Will the Seahawks or Patriots win? Who will be the MVP? Our analysts and reporters make their predictions.

title: Road to $1M paydays: How WNBA salaries evolved with each CBA
content: For the first time, a $1 million base salary is expected in the new WNBA CBA, and the cap could see a 230% increase.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stack up ahead of trade deadline
content: Which players are under the most pressure and where all 30 teams rank a day before the Thursday trade deadline.

title: Soccer's newest superagent is doing things differently -- and he wants you to know it
content: Ali Barat is impossible to miss -- last summer's transfer window was dominated by his clients making big moves -- yet hard to track down. It's all part of his mystique.

title: Grab your popcorn -- it's Man City vs. Arsenal for the Carabao Cup, and maybe more
content: Man City's win in the Carabao Cup semis sets the stage for a final vs. Arsenal, and a potentially thrilling end to the season.

title: A do-over of the 2025 NFL draft: Let's redraft the first 64 picks, with changes starting at No. 2
content: Abdul Carter to the Jets? Tyler Shough to the Browns? Emeka Egbuka to the 49ers? We repicked the first two rounds of last year's NFL draft.

title: How James Franklin raided Penn State's class and jump-started Virginia Tech recruiting
content: In a sprint to the early signing period, Franklin gutted his former school and brought life to the Hokies.

title: 12 teams that improved their 2026 CFP chances with their roster moves
content: With signing day closing many team's personnel moves, we look at the teams ready to make long postseason runs.

title: How to bet the WM Phoenix Open: Target these Maverick McNealy, Si Woo Kim props
content: The fourth stop of the PGA Tour season brings us to Scottsdale, where we can expect to see plenty of birdies at the WM Phoenix Open.

title: Super Bowl LX expected to see highest ticket price since 2020
content: Vivid Seats projects the crowd split in Santa Clara on Sunday will be a 61-39 advantage toward Seahawks fans.

title: The art of the pregame outfit and the stylist behind the NFL's crossover with fashion
content: From pregame style to fashion week, NFL fashion editor Kyle Smith helps players level up their style.

title: Ghostbusters: Back Darnold, Seahawks to exorcise some demons in Super Bowl LX
content: Liz Loza advises not to underestimate the revenge factor as Sam Darnold and the Seahawks face their New England demons in the Super Bowl

title: Transfer rumors, news: Sterling in Napoli talks after ending Chelsea contract
content: Raheem Sterling is in talks to join Napoli, while Barcelona and Real Madrid eye Tottenham's Cristian Romero. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Real Madrid's big transfer questions: What to do about Vini Jr., more
content: January transfer window was quiet, but there are plenty of issues for the club to address in the summer.

title: Wemby's minutes restriction, KAT's new offensive role, and more
content: A look around the league reveals the latest trends, from Victor Wembanyama's minute restriction to Karl-Anthony Towns' changing offensive role, and more.

title: From Harden and JJJ to Vucevic: Fantasy reaction to the latest NBA trades
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to the trade deadline.

title: Union Minister Amit Shah launches Bharat Taxi, first cooperative-led ride-hailing platform
content: "In three years, Bharat Taxi will be rolled out across the country, from Kashmir to Kanniyakumari and Dwarka to Kamakhya," Cooperation Minister Amit Shah said

title: Time to reopen closed tourist spots in J&K, will discuss with Shah: CM Abdullah
content: I believe the time has now come to reopen them. From the government's side, discussions with the Government of India on this issue are ongoing, says J&K CM Omar Abdullah

title: Tirumala laddu adulteration a grave offence, says A.P. CM
content: One-Man Committee to examine findings of investigating agencies and fix accountability and recommend action

title: UPSC CSE 2026 latest rules for serving civil servants: What has changed?
content: The UPSC has tightened eligibility rules for the Civil Services Examination, barring selected candidates to the IAS and IFS from reappearing, while imposing restrictions on IPS and other Group A officers

title: M. Murali, senior Congress leader and former Mavelikara MLA, passes away
content: He represented the constituency in the Assembly four times. He was a member of the first Senate of MG University

title: Land for border fencing not an issue, Centre must roll back BSF jurisdiction expansion rule: Mamata Banerjee
content: “They understand only one word, infiltration. Will the youth and new voters not get enrolled?”, Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee asked, arguing that excessive securitisation of border areas risks disrupting democratic processes and the lives of ordinary people

title: Closely monitoring situation in Iran; no reports of any Indian being killed during protests: Govt.
content: Minister of State for External Affairs Kirti Vardhan Singh says the Indian Embassy in Tehran continues to be in ‘regular contact’ with the Indian nationals, including students in Iran, and is providing them suitable guidance

title: Kerala leaves two posts of non-Muslims vacant in reconstituted State Waqf Board
content: The State government reportedly chose to leave the posts vacant to signal that it is not in a hurry to implement the provisions of the Act that was stiffly opposed by Muslim organisations

title: Chief Minister Stalin unveils statue of ‘Kalaivanar’ N.S. Krishnan at Chennai after relocation
content: After the actor died in 1957, the statue was first installed on G.N. Chetty Road-Thirumalai Pillai Road junction in 1969

title: Anurag Thakur free to participate in BCCI affairs, SC says; modifies 2017 order
content: On January 2, 2017, the court had directed Mr. Thakur to “forthwith cease and desist from being associated with the working of BCCI”

title: Janardhan Reddy hits back at YSRCP for its protest over RLIS
content: The Minister said that Mr. Jagan Mohan Reddy did not even spend ₹2 lakh crore for Rayalaseema even as ₹12 lakh crore was allocated in the Budget during his tenure

title: YSRCP indulges in hate politics: Kondru Muralimohan
content: He said that Opposition party was trying to divert the attention of the people with regard to use of adulterated ghee for the preparation of Tirupati laddu

title: CBFC says it cannot certify movies that undermine social harmony
content: It files a counter affidavit before the Madras High Court defending its decision to deny certification to Lakshmi-Lawrence Kadhal

title: 12 Maoists with ₹46 lakh bounty surrender in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
content: The cadres, including eight women, belonging to the 'south sub zonal buro' of Maoists, turned themselves in before senior police officials here under the Bastar police's 'Poona Margem' (from rehabilitation to social reintegration) initiative, Bijapur Superintendent of Police Jitendra Kumar Yadav said.

title: Six-laning works on NH 66 in Kerala enter final phase, 492 km opened for traffic, says Minister
content: Kerala Public Works Minister says some defects had occurred at some places during the construction work, and following the State’s request the National Highways Authority of India has informed that 10 agencies have been appointed to conduct expert inspections on 17 stretches.

title: Tamil Nadu Cabinet approves investment proposals worth ₹34,237 crore
content: With an intention to take the blue economy to the next level and to provide opportunities for fishermen, an initiative is underway in shipbuilding, Minister for Industries T.R.B. Rajaa said.

title: Supreme Court reschedules hearing on Sonam Wangchuk’s detention to February 9
content: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk’s wife argues that the detention violates fundamental rights, while government officials defend the action as necessary for national security following violent protests in Leh

title: Refund partial fare to rail passengers who pay charge but don't get full berth under RAC: Parliament panel
content: Under the current practice, the railways charge full fare from a passenger to book a berth in trains under the RAC category. However, the passenger may remain in the RAC category and share the berth with another RAC passenger. Both passengers pay full fare to the railways

title: CPI(M) interference delaying Sabarimala gold theft probe; no bar on questioning anyone, including Sonia Gandhi: Sunny Joseph
content: KPCC president says delay in probe was ‘allowing the accused to exploit legal loopholes and secure bail’

title: Speaker Om Birla says he advised PM not to come to Lok Sabha, had ‘definite information’ of Opposition protests
content: Om Birla also reprimanded the Opposition for their behaviour in his chamber as Congress members questioned BJP MP Nishikant Dubey’s allegations against former Congress PMs

title: Doubts over cause of death of PG doctor at Vijayawada Government Hospital
content: The final year student collapsed in the wee hours and was admitted in GGH where she died while undergoing treatment in the early hours on Thursday, Machavaram CI D. V. Ramana said

title: Watch: Kerala Assembly disrupted amid Sabarimala gold theft row
content: Kerala Assembly proceedings were adjourned early on February 5 amid protests by the Congress-led UDF over the Sabarimala gold theft case. Opposition MLAs disrupted Question Hour, raising slogans and demanding action against those allegedly involved.

title: Three days after preying on a calf, Tadoba tiger resorts to fresh kill near Rajamahendravaram city
content: The forest officials have alerted the locals not to attend their farm work to avoid any untoward incidents

title: Ensuring energy security for 1.4 billion people India's top priority: MEA after U.S. claim on Russian oil purchase
content: "Diversifying our energy sourcing in keeping with objective market conditions and evolving international dynamics is at the core of our strategy to ensure this," External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said

title: Delay in ‘Jana Nayagan’ release frustrates Tamil film industry
content: Other Pongal releases, namely Parasakthi andVaa Vaathiyaar, couldn’t keep the money flowing at the box office. Only Thalaivar Thambi Thalaimaiyil unexpectedly became a runaway hit, providing some respite to the exhibitors

title: Watch: Delhi Police arrests Al Falah University’s chairman in forgery case
content: The Crime Branch of Delhi Police has arrested Jawad Ahmed Siddiqui, chairman of Al Falah University, in connection with alleged forgery and irregularities linked to the institution.

title: Tamil Nadu government constitutes district-level committees to abolish police orderly system, Madras High Court told
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and C. Kumarappan of Madras High Court take on file a Government Order issued on January 21, 2026

title: ED launches probe against Nedumparambil Credit Syndicate Group in Kerala under PMLA
content: Preliminary findings revealed that several depositors across Kerala were persuaded to invest substantial sums, which were neither repaid nor yielded the promised returns

title: West Bengal Govt. moves resolution in Assembly over 'hardships' due to SIR; Speaker rejects
content: Speaker Biman Banerjee contended that since the matter was pending before the Supreme Court, the Assembly could not deliberate on it

title: SC takes serious note of delay by several states in sending proposal for DGP appointment
content: The apex court granted four weeks to the UPSC to convene a meeting and make recommendation for appointment of Director General of Police (DGP) for Telangana, where the last regular DPG retired in 2017

title: Assam mahouts get Australian tips on handling elephants humanely
content: Northeastern India was the first stop for the team’s five-step training module covering seven Asian countries employing about 5,000 captive elephants

title: Deepak death case: Shimjitha released in police custody
content: Police sources say she will be taken to Kannur district soon for collecting further evidence on her bus journey in Payyannur

title: India-U.S. trade deal: Joint statement in ‘four to five days’, legal agreement by mid-March, says Piyush Goyal
content: Commerce Minister said the U.S. will drop tariffs on India to 18% after the joint statement is issued. India, however, will be able to cut tariffs on U.S. goods only after the formal agreement is signed

title: India, Sri Lanka connected by deep civilisational, spiritual bonds: PM Modi on relics exposition
content: The first-ever international exposition of these sacred relics, which originate from the Devnimori archaeological site in Gujarat's Aravalli district, is taking place at Gangaramaya Temple from February 4-11

title: Elephant tramples mahout to death at Kottoor rehabilitation centre in Kerala
content: The elephant, named Manu, reportedly crushed its first mahout, Vishnu, to death during the morning bathing session

title: Jammu & Kashmir Govt to allot land to calamity-hit landless families on lease basis: CM Omar Abdullah
content: “More than 6,400 families hit by flash floods and landslides in Udhampur district have been provided financial assistance,” CM Omar Abdulla said

title: U.S. shuts down over 200 ‘illegal’ online pharmacies tied to India-based TCO
content: The Drug Enforcement Administration launched searches on January 27 across the U.S., leading to the arrest of four individuals along with the issuance of five Immediate Suspension Orders

title: 25 ITMS cameras capturing traffic violations on Mysuru-Bengaluru highway
content: However, more than 90% of the penalties imposed on motorists for violating traffic rules are yet to be paid

title: Supreme Court agrees to hear in March PIL against poll freebies promises by political parties
content: The plea urged the court to declare that the promise of "irrational freebies" from public funds before elections unduly influences the voters, disturbs the level-playing field and vitiates the purity of the poll process

title: Industrialist takes helicopter after being stuck for 8 hours on Mumbai-Pune Expressway
content: Reacting to the prolonged traffic disruption, Sudhir Mehta said such incidents highlight the need for better emergency preparedness on high-speed corridors like the Mumbai-Pune Expressway.

title: Supreme Court stays Madras HC's interim order halting Tamil Nadu government’s provision to appoint Vice-Chancellors
content: Since we are setting aside primarily on technical grounds, our order should have no bearing on the merits of the case, the Bench said

title: Sabarimala gold loss case: Kerala court grants statutory bail to prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti
content: Bail was granted as SIT probing the case failed to file a chargesheet within 90 days of Potti’s arrest, making him eligible for statutory bail

title: Lok Sabha passes motion of thanks on President's address without PM's customary reply
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla put the Opposition amendments to the Motion of Thanks to vote, which were rejected; Congress recalls Manmohan Singh was prevented from speaking on 2004 President’s address

title: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party moves SC challenging Bihar elections, seeks fresh polls
content: The matter likely to come up for hearing on Friday (February 6, 2026) has also questioned direct cash transfer of ₹10,000 to women

title: Concerned that FTA may cut access to medicines in India, rest of the developing world: Médecins Sans Frontières writes to EU
content: The group also said that some provisions which are part of the negotiation seeks to limit, and in some cases completely block, generic competition

title: Maoist killed in encounter with security personnel in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
content: There has been a rise in fatalities among insurgents as the government aims to eliminate Left-Wing Extremism by the end of March

title: Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic resumes after 33 hours; overturned gas tanker removed
content: The tanker overturned on the Mumbai-bound carriageway around 5 p.m. on Tuesday (February 3, 2026), triggering a massive traffic congestion that left thousands of vehicles stranded for hours on the busy expressway

title: Allahabad HC acquits nearly 100-year-old man over four decades after he got bail in murder case
content: The murder happened in 1982 over a land dispute, and three persons, including Dhami Ram was accused in the case

title: Ambati Rambabu’s daughter alleges TDP MLA’s role in attack on house
content: TDP MLA Galla Madhavi denies allegations, says she went to Ambati Rambabu’s house to seek an apology for the latter’s derogatory remarks on CM

title: I praise India for having assumed leadership for AI Impact Summit: UN chief Guterres
content: Secretary General Guterres will be travelling to India to attend the India–AI Impact Summit 2026 that will be held on February 19-20 in New Delhi

title: YSRCP will respond firmly if ‘Jungle Raj’ continues in A.P., says Jagan
content: The State government is trying to divert public attention after lab reports exposed claims on Tirupati laddu issue, says the YSRCP president

title: Over 100 boxes of explosives seized from pick-up van in Kerala's Palakkad
content: Police say over 100 boxes of gelatin sticks and more than 20 boxes of detonators found in the vehicle. The boxes were hidden under a consignment of watermelons

title: New session of Manipur assembly to begin on February 5
content: Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla has summoned the seventh session of the 12th Manipur Legislative Assembly at 4 p.m.

title: Man who tried to shoot Trump at Florida golf course gets life in prison
content: U.S. District Judge Aileen Cannon pronounced Ryan Routh's fate in the same Fort Pierce courtroom that erupted into chaos in September when he tried to stab himself shortly after jurors found him guilty on all counts

title: Odisha govt’s pending telephone bills run into crores
content: Union Minister Jyotiraditya M. Scindia shot off three reminders in recent months requesting Odisha government to clear dues of BSNL which is under financial stress

title: First English medium playschool in Rajasthan village set to benefit rural children
content: The playschool has been opened at Shaheed Suresh Singh Government Senior Secondary School in Lambi-Sahad, under Lambi-Ahir village panchayat, with transportation facility and inclusive access

title: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal’s statement on trade deal is a no-statement, says Congress
content: High-sounding claims go completely contrary to what the U.S. President, the U.S. Secretary of Agriculture, and the U.S. Trade Representative have put out, says Jairam Ramesh

title: Privileges Committee toprobe Punjab Police role in ‘doctored’ video row
content: Speaker has concluded prima facie case of breach of privilege exists after examining police force’s reply: Secretariat; panel directed to submit detailed report in accordance with Rules of Procedure

title: U.K. asks Air India to explain Boeing Dreamliner fuel-switch incident
content: The U.K. Civil Aviation Authority warned of the possibility of regulatory action against Air India and its Boeing 787 fleet if the airline does not submit a complete response ​within a week

title: Yatnal alleges bias in Karnataka BJP’s fight against corruption
content: Referring to the protest seeking resignation of Excise Minister R.B. Thimmapur over alleged corruption, he maintained that BJP should have shown a similar approach with respect to alleged corruption by other Ministers

title: Centre gives a pittance to T.N. despite State ranking 2nd on economic front: CM Stalin
content: Tamil Nadu is the most urbanised State and has the most number of industries, Stalin says, adding that it is one of the major contributors of tax revenue and works hard for country’s development.

title: DVAC assures court of proper probe into ED’s plaint against T.N. Minister Nehru’s department
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan reserve orders on two writ petitions insisting upon registration of a FIR

title: Andre Beteille: A sociologist with rigorous scholarship who laid emphasis on importance of fieldwork
content: Former colleagues and students recall his steadfast commitment to teaching at Delhi School of Economics, rigorous scholarship

title: Fake currency racket busted, four arrested in Andhra
content: The accused were printing counterfeit currency notes in Visakhapatnam district and circulating them in different places, say police

title: 'Asked PM not to come to House': LS Speaker says plot by Cong MPs to create 'inappropriate incident'
content: Lok Sabha was adjourned amid security concerns over alleged Congress plans to attack Prime Minister Narendra Modi, despite his presence. Opposition rejected the claims, accusing the government of stalling proceedings. The Prime Minister is expected to address the Rajya Sabha later.

title: After IPL exclusion, Lahore Qalandars sign Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman for PSL
content: Lahore Qalandars have secured Bangladesh fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman for the 2026 Pakistan Super League season. Rahman, a former Qalandar, returns to the franchise after a stint with Kolkata Knight Riders in the IPL. His signing comes after recent developments involving the IPL and Bangladesh cricket.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai says he is pleased on partnership with Apple as their preferred ….
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai expressed satisfaction with the growing partnership with Apple, highlighting its significance for Google's cloud and AI strategy. The collaboration will see Google's Gemini technology powering the next generation of Apple Foundation Models, enhancing features like Siri and Apple Intelligence while upholding privacy standards.

title: 'Bizarre thing...': Shashi Tharoor reacts to son Ishan being sacked by Washington Post
content: Reacting on X, Tharoor wrote: “The bizarre thing about this so-called ‘business decision’ by The Washington Post is that @ishaantharoor’s column flourished on the Internet,” adding that Ishaan Tharoor had “500,000 (half a million plus!) individual subscribers” for his WorldView newsletter. He said he had met foreign ministers, diplomats and scholars around the world who read the newsletter daily, and argued that the newspaper could have tried monetising that reach instead of abolishing it.

title: BCCI | SC grants relief to Anurag Thakur, free to return to cricket administration
content: The Supreme Court has granted relief to former BCCI chief Anurag Thakur, potentially paving his return to cricket administration. The court modified a 2017 order that barred him from BCCI affairs, acknowledging the ban's lengthy duration. This decision follows Thakur's plea for modification, aiming to lift the nine-year restriction.

title: 'Was fired because my manager was insecure': Employee shares how toxic leadership damages companies
content: A talented content professional was abruptly fired after his manager perceived his viral comedy reel, satirizing corporate life, as a threat. Despite a recent salary hike and strong performance, Ajay Sharma Chinta was forced to resign, highlighting how insecurity and office politics can stifle creativity and lead to talent loss within companies.

title: Dell sued by 5 ex-employees; complaint alleges that the company mismanaged its 401(k) plan
content: Five ex-Dell employees are suing the tech giant, alleging its 401(k) plan mismanagement cost workers over $318 million. The lawsuit claims Dell violated federal law by keeping workers in underperforming investment funds while profiting from its own products.  This class action seeks to recover losses and reform the retirement plan's operations.

title: T20 World Cup: 'Humari flight book hai Colombo ki' - India captain Surya on Pakistan clash
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed the team will head to Colombo for their T20 World Cup match against Pakistan, despite uncertainty.  Pakistan's Salman Ali Agha stated their participation hinges on government directives, with the Pakistani government having previously announced a boycott of the February 15th fixture.

title: 'Bharat Taxi' will be rolled out across India in 3 years: Amit Shah at launch
content: Union cooperation minister Amit Shah launched 'Bharat Taxi', India's first cooperative-led ride-hailing platform, after a successful pilot. Initially available in Delhi-NCR and Gujarat, the service aims for nationwide expansion within three years, sharing profits directly with drivers. This indigenous platform offers zero-commission, surge-free pricing and social security benefits for its drivers.

title: Google crosses $400 billion revenue mark for the first time; Elon Musk reacts
content: Google achieved a historic milestone, surpassing $400 billion in annual revenue for the first time in its Q4 2025 earnings report. CEO Sundar Pichai highlighted strong momentum across Google Services and Google Cloud, with AI advancements like Gemini driving significant growth and user engagement. The company anticipates substantial capital expenditures for 2026 to meet escalating customer demand.

title: The DIY therapy: When mental health advice comes from AI
content: Online symptom checkers and social media are leading many to self-diagnose mental health conditions, often bypassing professional help. This trend, fueled by accessible yet often inaccurate content, risks misdiagnosis, inappropriate self-treatment, and delayed care, especially in regions with limited mental healthcare access. Experts urge caution, emphasizing the complexity of clinical diagnosis.

title: Ghaziabad sisters' suicide: 'Death better than beatings', daughters wrote in diary
content: Three sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, died after falling from the ninth floor of their Ghaziabad apartment building. A neighbor witnessed the eldest sister on the window ledge with the younger two holding her, before they all fell. Police are investigating, with a diary and mobile phone recovered from the puja room.

title: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha on India match - 'Bangladesh are our brothers'
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha reiterated that the decision to skip the India match at the T20 World Cup rests entirely with the Pakistani government. While acknowledging fans will miss the marquee clash, Agha stressed the team’s focus is on the remaining group games.

title: Indian teacher Rouble Nagi, who painted educational murals across slums, wins Global Teacher Prize
content: Indian teacher and activist Rouble Nagi has won the Global Teacher Prize in Dubai for her work establishing over 800 learning centers and creating educational murals in slum areas. Nagi plans to use the $1 million prize to build an institute offering free vocational training to students, continuing her mission to make education accessible.

title: Job scams in UAE/Saudi: How to spot fake offers and agents
content: Gulf job seekers face sophisticated scams, with fraudsters using AI and social media to lure victims. Authorities warn against upfront fees for visas or processing, unverified emails, and unrealistic offers. Always verify job offers through official government channels like MoHRE and MHRSD to avoid falling prey to these deceptive schemes.

title: Epstein files: Not Trump, but this world leader may lose his job
content: The Jeffrey Epstein scandal is creating political pressure for UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer over his past appointment of Peter Mandelson, who is now under criminal investigation.  Meanwhile, US President Donald Trump faces no immediate threat despite his name appearing in Epstein files, highlighting differing political environments and institutional responses to the ongoing global fallout.

title: India-US trade deal: Joint statement in 4–5 days; agreement likely by mid-March, says Goyal
content: India and the US are set to finalize the first tranche of their bilateral trade agreement, with a joint statement expected within days. This deal, under negotiation since early 2025, aims to boost two-way trade to $500 billion by 2030, with India safeguarding sensitive sectors like agriculture and dairy.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold costs in your city? Check rates
content: Precious metals experienced a sharp downturn on Thursday, reversing recent gains as futures faced significant selling pressure. Weak global sentiment and a stronger US dollar contributed to the decline. Silver futures on MCX plunged by 10%, while gold futures also saw a notable drop, erasing previous recovery.

title: Gambhir visits Siddhivinayak, seeks blessings ahead of T20 World Cup
content: Ahead of their T20 World Cup title defense, head coach Gautam Gambhir and batting coach Sitanshu Kotak sought blessings at the Shree Siddhivinayak Temple. India, led by Suryakumar Yadav, enters the tournament as strong favorites, aiming to become the first team to successfully defend the men's T20 World Cup title.

title: 'No such visit took place': MEA rubbishes report claiming Doval–Rubio meet before India-US trade deal
content: The Ministry of External Affairs has firmly denied a Bloomberg report alleging National Security Adviser Ajit Doval met with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio regarding a trade deal. MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal called the claims baseless, stating no such meeting occurred. This rebuttal follows recent announcements of a trade agreement between India and the US.

title: Single spark could cause a fireball: 32-hour op that averted disaster on Pune–Mumbai Expressway
content: A 32-hour hazardous materials operation successfully averted a potential propylene gas disaster on the Pune-Mumbai Expressway. Specialized teams tackled multiple leaks from an overturned tanker carrying 21,000 kg of flammable gas, employing a high-risk decanting strategy and multi-agency coordination to prevent a catastrophic explosion.

title: Suniel Shetty questions why films talk about Auragzeb, Akbar but not Shivaji Maharaj, Rajputs
content: Suniel Shetty's film 'Kesari Veer' on Somnath Temple's destruction flopped due to poor distribution, not lack of research. Shetty lamented Hindi cinema's focus on invaders over Indian heroes like Shivaji and Rajputs, advocating for broader historical narratives. He stressed the importance of celebrating indigenous culture and heroes, echoing Akshay Kumar's sentiments on historical representation.

title: Mentally ill girl raped, impregnated; 16 rounded up for DNA tests, father turns out to be culprit
content: Mumbai police arrested a father after DNA tests confirmed he impregnated his 20-year-old daughter, who has a mental illness. Hospital staff discovered her five-month pregnancy during a medical examination. The investigation, triggered by the hospital's report, involved DNA comparisons from multiple men, ultimately identifying the father as the sole positive match.

title: Kerala headmistress barred from school gate for wearing churidar instead of saree
content: A headmistress was barred from entering her aided school in Kollam for wearing a churidar, sparking protests and police intervention. The school manager insisted on a saree, despite government orders permitting churidars. The headmistress, who filed a complaint, alleges ongoing harassment by the manager, who has faced prior misconduct allegations.

title: ‘Didn’t expect to be back ...’: Tilak Varma’s comeback lifts India’s WC mood
content: Tilak Varma made a remarkable comeback from injury, scoring a quickfire 45 off 19 balls in India's T20 World Cup warm-up win against South Africa. Expressing gratitude for his accelerated recovery, Varma credited the BCCI and CoE, feeling immense support from the crowd. The team's aggressive batting energy inspired his free-flowing play, signaling readiness for the World Cup opener.

title: Brad Keselowski and Paige White’s combined net worth: Earnings, investments and lifestyle
content: NASCAR star Brad Keselowski has amassed a fortune exceeding $144 million through his racing career and strategic business ventures. Beyond the track, his investments in RFK Racing and advanced manufacturing highlight a focus on long-term financial security.  His wife, Paige White, supports family operations, contributing to their estimated $45-50 million net worth.

title: Walking for a healthy heart isn’t just walking: Here’s how to make it work harder
content: Forget intense workouts; consistent walking is a powerful heart health booster.  A Harvard study revealed brisk walking for 30 minutes daily significantly cuts heart disease risk.  Experts emphasize purposeful, brisk walks with elevated breathing and light sweat for optimal benefits.  Regularity and proper technique are key, even for casual walkers, to strengthen the heart effectively.

title: 'Limitless potential!': Sergio Gor hails India-US ties; points to high level talks
content: India and the US are set to deepen their bilateral ties, with Ambassador Gor highlighting readiness for elevated engagement. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's recent meetings with US officials, including Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, covered trade, energy, defense, and critical minerals, signaling a robust economic and strategic partnership ahead.

title: Specialists back in vogue: India’s team management takes a U-turn ahead of T20 WC
content: MS Dhoni's rare praise highlights India's formidable T20 World Cup squad, deemed 'one of the most dangerous teams.' A ruthless selection process and strategic pivots, particularly under coach Gautam Gambhir, have forged an immaculately balanced unit. With aggression as the core principle and specialists in key roles, Team India appears stronger than ever, poised to dominate.

title: Woman detained for abusing Greater Noida condo residents over walking pet dog
content: A Greater Noida woman was detained by police after a pet dog allegedly defecated in a common area, sparking a heated argument. Residents claim the owner used abusive language when confronted about designated pet zones. A viral video of the confrontation led to a formal complaint and the woman's questioning by Bisrakh police, who stated legal action would follow.

title: 'Border 2' box office day 14: Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan film inches towards Rs 300 cr
content: 'Border 2' continues its strong box office journey, crossing ₹291 crore despite a recent dip after its initial surge. The film, which saw a significant boost from the Republic Day holiday, is now earning single-digit figures in its second week. While it held its ground against 'Mardaani 3', the ensemble cast's film is showing signs of slowing down.

title: Man kicked, punched, beaten in Delhi for objecting to harassment of women
content: A 26-year-old businessman was brutally assaulted in south Delhi's Mehrauli after he intervened to stop four men from harassing three women. The attackers beat him severely, even after he lost consciousness. Police have arrested all four accused, who have been charged under various sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Abhishek Bachchan at 50: Reinventing, staying motivated, why cynicism never won — Exclusive
content: Abhishek Bachchan, marking 25 years in Bollywood, embraces reinvention as he turns 50.  Despite facing numerous flops and public scrutiny, he remains grounded, acknowledging his privilege while crediting his survival to merit.  He emphasizes the necessity of constant evolution to connect with new audiences and avoid becoming stale, a lesson learned from observing industry peers.

title: Fortnite v39.40 update: All new content and changes revealed
content: Fortnite's v39.40 update arrives February 5, 2026. Players can expect Valentine's Day celebrations and new cosmetics. KPop Demon Hunters Wave 2 returns with new characters. Chappell Roan headlines Fortnite Festival Season 13. Shockwave Grenades will be unvaulted, while Crash Pad Jrs. are vaulted. This update brings fresh content and gameplay adjustments.

title: Karnataka man attacked for accompanying Muslim woman, forced to record ‘love confession’
content: In a troubling incident in Gangavathi, four Muslim youths have been apprehended following their alleged assault on salesman Venkatesh Avalamand. The salesman reported that after confronting him about his association with a Muslim woman, the youths invaded his privacy by checking his phone, demanding he profess love, and recording the encounter.

title: Birthday balloons explode inside lift in Mumbai’s Goregaon
content: A young student, Himani Tapriya, sustained severe burns after dozens of gas-filled balloons exploded in a lift at Amol Tower, Goregaon. The incident occurred when a delivery man, Raju Kumar Mahato, entered the lift with the balloons. Police have registered a negligence case against the shop owner for failing to provide safety instructions to his employee, who also suffered injuries.

title: Monkey snatches baby in UP village, releases it in exchange for rotis
content: Alert villagers in Amroha district rescued a one-and-a-half-month-old infant snatched by a monkey. The monkey grabbed the baby from a courtyard and climbed onto the roof. Villagers lured the animal away with rotis, allowing them to safely retrieve the child. Residents are demanding action against the increasing monkey menace.

title: How Does Bangladesh Vote, How Are Votes Counted: All You Need To Know
content: Bangladesh will allow postal voting for the first time in its history in the February 12 national election, the Election Commission announced last month.

title: "Congress MPs Might Try Something": Speaker Says Asked PM To Skip Lok Sabha
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's reply to the Motion of Thanks on the President's address was cancelled in view of an alarm that the Congress had planned a physical attack on him, government sources said.

title: First Came Gmail, And Now Jmail - A Peek Into Jeffrey Epstein's Inbox
content: The US Justice Department has publicly released thousands more documents from the estate of registered sex offender and disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 4 Live: Speaker Says He Asked PM To Skip Lok Sabha Amid Safety Concerns
content: Parliament Budget Session2026 Day 4 Live Updates: The Opposition parties will hold a key meet at Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge's office at 10 am.

title: Opinion: Blog | The Descent Of Man (And MP) - By Shashi Tharoor
content: "Having spent decades navigating the slippery slopes of policy and the treacherous inclines of debate, it was, quite ironically, a simple marble step that proved to be my undoing."

title: Jeff Bezos-Owned Washington Post Fires Tech Reporter Who Covered Amazon
content: Caroline O'Donovan, who joined The Post in 2022, reported on technology companies and corporate accountability, with a particular focus on Amazon.

title: Wanted For 24 Murders, Bihar Man And Son Were Hiding In Bengaluru For A Year
content: Manik and Manoj have been named in nearly 40 criminal cases, including two dozen murder cases, and face charges of robbery, dacoity, extortion, and violations of the Arms Act.

title: Shashi Tharoor Fractures Leg After Parliament Fall, Says "Lagne Do Nazar"
content: An optimistic Shashi Tharoor said he will continue his parliamentary duties and campaign work in Kerala despite suffering a hairline fracture after a fall on Wednesday.

title: No PM Speech And A Congress Message Behind Parliament Showdown
content: Parliament proceedings have been disrupted since Monday, but central to the standoff appears to be a charge from the Congress and a message to the dispensation.

title: Why Did Xi Jinping Hold Back-To-Back Calls With Putin, Trump?
content: China's leader Xi Jinping held back-to-back calls with Russia's Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump this week, timing analysts said was rare and significant as Beijing positions itself as a stable global power.

title: Al Falah University Chairman Jawad Ahmed Siddiqui Arrested In Fraud Case
content: The Delhi Police Crime Branch has arrested Al Falah University Chairman Jawad Ahmed Siddiqui in connection with alleged financial and administrative irregularities, officials confirmed on Thursday.

title: Man, Once Married To Jill Biden, Arrested Without Bail For Wife's 'Killing'
content: A Delaware man who was once married to former first lady Jill Biden decades ago remains in jail on first-degree murder charges as authorities investigate the death of his wife.

title: 25 Police Teams, 200 CCTVs: How Bhopal Serial Knife Attacker Was Caught
content: Bhopal breathed a collective sigh of relief as police finally arrested the serial knife attacker who had terrorised young women across the city for nearly a week.

title: US And Russia Enter Uncertain Era As Key Nuclear Pact Expires
content: The last major arms control agreement between the US and Russia expired Thursday, increasing the risk of a new arms race between the world's two largest nuclear powers amid growing global instability.

title: Foreign Liquor, Hookah, Luxury Cars: Inside Silver Jubilee Party In Ahmedabad
content: Acting on a specific tip-off, police raided the venue, uncovering a scene of luxury and law-breaking, and detained 81 people, including prominent builders, doctors, and business professionals from across the city.

title: Watermelons And Weapons: Concealed Consignment Seized On Kerala Highway
content: Kerala Police seized a large cache of explosive materials that were allegedly being smuggled into Kerala concealed inside a mini-lorry carrying watermelons.

title: How Pakistani Jaish Terrorist, Who Dodged Security Forces 20 Times, Was Killed In J&K
content: Security forces have dealt a big blow to Pakistan-backed terrorism, eliminating a notorious Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) terrorist in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district.

title: Nurse Shot Dead Outside Health Centre In Madhya Pradesh
content: Panic and terror gripped Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district on Wednesday night after a female staff nurse was shot dead right outside the gate of the Shahgarh Community Health Center.

title: ICE Can't Make Warrantless Arrests In Oregon Unless There's Risk Of Escape
content: US immigration agents in Oregon must stop arresting people without warrants unless there's a likelihood of escape, a federal judge ruled Wednesday.

title: US Student Discovers 1.5 Million New Space Objects. Scientists Are Bewildered
content: What began as a summer learning project has turned into a scientific discovery. An American high school student has identified nearly 1.5 million previously unknown objects in space.

title: MMA divisional rankings: Benoit Saint Denis, Mauricio Ruffy rise at lightweight
content: Saturday's UFC 325 was headlined by a meeting between the No. 1-ranked featherweight, champion  Alexander Volkanovski , and No. 2  Diego Lopes , a fight won by the champ. But it was one weight class heavier where the fight card impacted the ESPN divisional MMA rankings. Lightweight  Benoît Saint Denis  knocked out  Dan Hooker  in the co-main event to move up three spots to No. 7. And in the fight right before that,  Mauricio Ruffy  scored a knockout of  Rafael Fiziev  to earn a place in the top 10. Those were the only changes in the rankings. Here are the  ESPN pound-for-pound MMA rankings  and a  list of current UFC champions  in all weight classes. Results are current; rankings as of Feb. 3. To be eligible for the rankings, a fighter must have competed over the past 12 months or must have an upcoming fight booked. Fighters who have been dropped for inactivity can be reinstated only after they compete.

title: Ryan Preece overcomes sleet, cautions to win The Clash
content: sleet, a wet track and a record number of cautions to win The Clash . the event had originally been scheduled for Sunday but was twice postponed because of snow that blanketed the state .

title: Bracketology: Duke returns to top 16, Princeton suffers biggest slide
content: Content extraction failed.

title: Super Bowl squares: Printable grid for your Patriots-Seahawks party
content: the super bowl squares pool is one of the most popular games . we have you covered for super Bowl LX between the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots . you can draw numbers out of a hat, use a deck of cards or a random number generator .

title: An epic Rookie of the Year race? 2026 predictions for MLB's top prospects
content: Kiley McDaniel has ranked the best prospects and farm systems in baseball ahead of the 2026 MLB season . the list includes Caden Scarborough, who will be a fixture in the Tigers' every-day lineup by the end of the season.

title: Projecting Rounds 1-2 of the draft: Landing spots for 11 Senior Bowl standouts
content: a mock draft of 2026 draft starts April 23 in Pittsburgh . more than 100 prospects from the Senior Bowl will join hundreds of others at the combine . the draft will shuffle draft boards, and free agency next month will alter needs of each team .

title: ✨ Top 10 MLB prospect rankings for every team
content: the top 10 prospects for all 30 major league farm systems are listed below . players in the big leagues are eligible for this update as MLB rookie eligibility rules apply here . there are 130 at-bats, 50 innings pitched or 45 days on the active roster .

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Mixed reaction to Volkanovski's rematch win
content: Alexander Volkanovski beats Diego Lopes by unanimous decision at uFC 325 . the featherweight champion moves slightly, from no. 9 to no. 8 . rafael nadal leads the rankings with a 2-0 win over san francisco .

title: NHL trade grades: Who comes out ahead in Artemi Panarin trade?
content: the 2025-26 NHL trade season is off to a busy start . the Vancouver Canucks traded defenseman Rasmus Andersson to the Vegas Golden Knights . earlier, the Pittsburgh Penguins sent goaltender Tristan Jarry and forward Sam Poulin to the Edmonton Oilers .
